reviewText: Wow, where do I start well first off Talspin was a great cartoon when it aired over two decades ago on television and when I found it on amazon I had to purchase the dvd as soon as possible. This was a wonderful show years ago now I have to watch it all over again.

reviewText: I grew up watching TaleSpin and I bought the two DVD sets a few years ago. The series is one of the best cartoons ever made. I only wish that Disney would bring Volume Three out.The episodes in Volume Two:Disc One:A Baloo SwitcherooWhistlestop Jackson, LegendDouble Or NothingFeminine AirLast HorizonsFlight of the Snow DuckSave the TigerThe Old Main and the Sea DuckWar of the WeirdsDisc Two:Captains OutrageousThe Time BanditFor Whom the Bell Klangs - Part OneFor Whom the Bell Klangs - Part TwoCitizen KhanGruel and Unusual PunishmentA Jolly Molly ChristmasMy Fair BalooWaiders of the Worst TweasureDisc Three:Flight School ConfidentialBringing Down BabyfaceJumping the GunsIn Search of Ancient BlundersLouie's Last StandSheepskin DeepPizza Pie In the SkyBaloo ThunderBullethead Baloo

Title: TaleSpin, Volume 2

reviewText: I've waited for this collection for a while, and I was finally able to get it.  Volume 2 has some of the best episodes of the show, including "Jolly Molly Christmas", a very touching episode that kids and parents will love.  Unfortunately, the DVD is still lacking in any special features, commentaries, or interviews.  I was hoping they would have that by now, but I guess this is just something Disney does on the side while they devote their energy to making second-hand movie sequels.  But, if you bought volume I, you should definitely get this.  It'll be money well-spent.
Title: TaleSpin, Volume 2

reviewText: As with season 1, this was so much fun to watch again after all these years and I remembered most of the episodes still. I was sad one of my favorites wasn't on season 1 or 2 though. If you've never seen these before, it's a great show to watch, young or old :)
Title: TaleSpin, Volume 2

reviewText: The second installment of Disney's TaleSpin brings me out of my 'Bear-ish laid-backness' as three of my top five TS episodes are featured here - 'The Old Man & The Sea Duck' (DISC ONE), "For Whom The Bell Klangs" Parts One & Two & 'Citizen Khan' (DISC TWO), "Flight School Confidential" (DISC THREE). Oh, Did I mention "A Jolly Molly Christmas"?? Umm, sounds like a Christmas-time rush to get this. Sadly, this box set doesn't have any added features or interviews from those who helped create this masterpiece 17 -short- years ago. I'm hoping Disney will add extra behind-the-scenes featurettes for the final box set next year (along with comments from co-creator Jymn Magon, Bob Taylor and the remaining surviving voice cast involved with the GREATEST ANIMATED TV SERIES EVER) and maybe have fan video/website features too (Listening Disney??? You have my email on this site.) Thanks for your time. SPIN IT!!! JG
Title: TaleSpin, Volume 2

reviewText: This show is just as great as I remember as a child. worth the investment, delivered in great condition too. One more season to own.

reviewText: This was one of my favorite tv series as a kid.  I admit I  had a huge crush on Kit.  He was both sweet and  not over sweet.  He was brave and adventurous yet deep and more than a little insecure.  I  sure hope this set has  the really great episodes like Flight School Confidential, Jolly Molly Christmas  (yes Molly there is a santa claus) and  The time bandits.  Can hardly wait to get this one.  I already have and love season 1.
summary: Finally  one of the best cartoons

reviewText: This brings back my childhood, I wish Disney would bring back some of these classics! A MUST HAVE FOR ANY DISNEY FAN!
Title: TaleSpin, Volume 2

reviewText: The second DVD set includes many favorites episodes of mine (Save the Tiger, Last Horizons, The Old Man and the Sea Duck, My Fair Baloo, Jolly Molly christmas...and so many more!)This series is the best TV series ever produced. The series can appeal to everyone, boys and girls, kids and adults (something that Disney is REALLY lacking nowadays) : it has funny situations and deals with serious matters (sometimes both in the same episode, and it works very well) In fact, EVERYONE who has seen the series later as an adult think it's even better than when they were kids!!! Check around the web if you don't believe me. (and nostalgia has nothing to do with that, unlike most cartoons!)It has the greatest characters ever made : they have a real depth and multi-sided personalities, which is not very common for cartoons. Even the characters coming from the Jungle Book (especially Baloo and Shere Khan) are much more interesting in TaleSpin! The soundtrack is the best Disney has ever produced for a series. The episodes are very varied, it's never repetitive (which is the biggest flaw of most cartoons nowadays, especially Phineas & Ferb) and the art is magnificent (characters styles and sceneries are a mix of the best of American and Japan animation!)The only "flaw" would be the sometimes inconsistent animation, due to several production facilities, but the animation is still top notch overall.It's probably the most underrated Disney production ever, due to them never really backing it unfortunately. It's already a miracle they've released the TaleSpin DVDs! I would really love Disney to come back to it and make a direct-to-video film or even (let's dream) a feature film. It truly deserves it. There are so many great TaleSpin stories that could be told...NB : If you only have the first set, I REALLY recommend getting this one because it's even better! Pure masterpiece.
summary: The best TV series, 2nd volume even better!
Title: TaleSpin, Volume 2
